subject: Languages
title: Sanskrit: The Perfect Language
description: A short lesson to help you apply Sanskrit: The Perfect Language.

hook.text: Ancient Indian scholars called Sanskrit 'the perfected language.' They weren't being modest.

buildup.text: Sanskrit is one of the oldest Indo-European languages, with texts dating to roughly 1500 BC.

discovery.text: Its grammar was codified by Panini around 400 BC in the most sophisticated grammar ever written.

twist.text: Panini's grammar rules are so precise that computer scientists compare them to programming languages.

climax.text: Sanskrit became the language of Hindu philosophy, Buddhist texts, and Indian science for 3,000 years.

punchline.text: A language formalized 2,400 years ago still impresses computer scientists today.
